thread.title: Matt Klentak Reportedly to Become Philadelphia Phillies GM
thread.title_full: Matt Klentak Reportedly to Become Philadelphia Phillies GM

author: Kelly Terez
title: Matt Klentak Reportedly to Become Philadelphia Phillies GM
text:
Share Article 
Brian Garfinkel/Getty Images (PHILADELPHIA) -- The Philadelphia Phillies have a new general manager. 
According to ESPN , the Phillies will now be managed by Los Angeles Angels assistant general manager Matt Klentak. 
The 36-year-old will replace Ruben Amaro Jr., who was fired after receiving criticism for the Phillies' poor season this year with a second straight last-place finish for the National League East, and for signing older players to long-term contracts. 
Klentak previously worked for the Colorado Rockies in 2003 as well as Major League Baseball's Labor Relations department for a number of years. 
The hiring of Klentak was first reported by the Boston Globe , and the Phillies have not confirmed the hire yet.
